entry.title: The Protection of Animals (Anaesthetics) (Scotland) Amendment Order 2003
entry.summary: This Order amends paragraph 6 of the First Schedule to the Protection of Animals (Anaesthetics) Act 1954. It reduces the age beyond which castration of pigs may not be performed without anaesthetic. Under this Order, castration may only be performed before the animal has reached the age of 8 days, as opposed to 4 weeks. This amendment is necessitated by the changes made by the Welfare of Farmed Animals (Scotland) Amendment Regulations 2003, implementing Council Directive 2001/88/EC (O.J. No. L 316, 1.12.2001, p.1) and Commission Directive 2001/93/EC (O.J. No. L 316 1.12.2001 p.36), which amend the Welfare of Farmed Animals (Scotland) Regulations 2000 (S.S.I. 2000/442 as amended by S.S.I. 2002/334), setting out requirements applying to the keeping of pigs. The amending Regulations include a similar provision relating to the castration of pigs.

entry.title: Motor Vehicles (Construction and Use) (Amendment No. 3) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2003
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the definition of “the emissions publication” in Schedule 10 to the Motor Vehicles (Construction and Use) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1999 so as to refer to the most recent (i.e. the ninth) edition of the publication entitled “In Service Exhaust Emission Standards for Road Vehicles”. The publication specifies, with respect to vehicles with spark ignition engines, the maximum permitted carbon monoxide content of exhaust emissions at idling speed and the limits for the ratio of air to petrol vapour entering the combustion chamber, in relation to each of the vehicle models named in the publication.

title.div: The Disability Discrimination (Prescribed Periods for Accessibility Strategies and Plans for Schools) (Wales) Regulations 2003 / Rheoliadau Gwahaniaethu ar Sail Anabledd (Cyfnodau Rhagnodedig ar gyfer Strategaethau a Chynlluniau Hygyrchedd ar gyfer Ysgolion) (Cymru) 2003

category.term: Special educational needs and additional support

div.p: This version of the The Disability Discrimination (Prescribed Periods for Accessibility Strategies and Plans for Schools) (Wales) Regulations 2003 is published under the authority and superintendence of the Queen's Printer of Acts of Parliament and Controller of HMSO. It has been prepared to reflect the text as it was Made.

Cyhoeddir y fersiwn hon o Rheoliadau Gwahaniaethu ar Sail Anabledd (Cyfnodau Rhagnodedig ar gyfer Strategaethau a Chynlluniau Hygyrchedd ar gyfer Ysgolion) (Cymru) 2003 o dan awdurdod a goruchwyliaeth Argraffydd Deddfau Seneddol y Frenhines a Rheolwr Gwasg Ei Mawrhydi. Fe'i paratowyd i adlewyrchu'r testun fel y'i gwnaed.

title.div: The Care Standards Act 2000 (Commencement No.12) (Wales) Order 2003 / Gorchymyn Deddf Safonau Gofal 2000 (Cychwyn Rhif 12) (Cymru) 2003

div.p: This Order brings into force a number of provisions of the Care Standards Act 2000 relating to the regulation of Nurses Agencies. This will have the effect of bringing these agencies within the regulatory framework of the Care Standards Act 2000. It will also bring into force the repeal of the Nurses Agencies Act 1957 under which these agencies have been licensed by the relevant Local Authority.

Mae'r Gorchymyn hwn yn dwyn i rym nifer o ddarpariaethau Deddf Safonau Gofal 2000 sy'n ymwneud â rheoleiddio Asiantaethau Nyrsio. Effaith hyn fydd dwyn yr asiantaethau hyn o fewn fframwaith reoliadol Deddf Safonau Gofal 2000. Bydd hefyd yn dwyn i rym ddiddymiad Deddf Asiantaethau Nyrsys 1957 y trwyddedwyd yr asiantaethau hyn odani gan yr Awdurdod Lleol perthnasol.

entry.title: The Criminal Justice (Scotland) Act 2003 (Commencement No. 3 and Revocation) Order 2003
entry.summary: This Order brings into force certain provisions of the Criminal Justice (Scotland) Act 2003 on the dates specified in the Schedule to the Order.

title.div: The Special Educational Needs and Disability Act 2001 (Commencement No. 2) (Wales) Order 2003 / Gorchymyn Deddf Anghenion Addysgol Arbennig ac Anabledd 2001 (Cychwyn Rhif 2) (Cymru) 2003

category.term: Special educational needs and additional support

div.p: This Order brings into force in Wales on 8th October 2003 the remaining provisions of the Special Educational Needs and Disability Act 2001 which are not in force in Wales at the date of this Order, so that no further Order is required in relation to Wales.

Mae'r Gorchymyn hwn yn dwyn i rym yng Nghymru ar 8 Hydref 2003 weddill darpariaethau Deddf Anghenion Addysgol Arbennig ac Anabledd 2001 nad ydynt mewn grym yng Nghymru ar ddyddiad y Gorchymyn hwn, fel na fydd angen Gorchymyn pellach mewn perthynas â Chymru.

title.div: The National Assistance (Assessment of Resources)(Amendment No. 2)(Wales) Regulations 2003 / Rheoliadau Cymorth Gwladol (Asesu Adnoddau) (Diwygiad Rhif 2) (Cymru) 2003

div.p: These regulations make further amendments to the National Assistance (Assessment of Resources) Regulations 1992 (“the Principal Regulations”). The Principal Regulations set out the basis on which local authorities assess the ability to pay of persons for whom they arrange accommodation under part 3 of the National Assistance Act 1948.

Mae'r Rheoliadau hyn yn gwneud diwygiadau pellach i Reoliadau Cymorth Gwladol (Asesu Adnoddau) 1992 (“y Prif Reoliadau”). Mae'r Prif Reoliadau yn gosod y sail y caiff awdurdodau lleol asesu gallu personau y maent yn trefnu llety ar eu cyfer i dalu o dan ran 3 o Ddeddf Cymorth Gwladol 1948.

entry.title: The Port of London Authority Harbour Revision Order 2003
entry.summary: This Order confers additional powers on the Port of London Authority (“the PLA”) in the interests of securing safety of navigation on the river Thames. In particular it—

title.div: The Oil and Fibre Plant Seeds (Amendment) (Wales) Regulations 2003 / Rheoliadau Hadau Planhigion Olew a Ffibr (Diwygio) (Cymru) 2003

div.p: These Regulations amend the Oil and Fibre Plants Seeds Regulations 1993 (S.I. 1993/2007) as amended (“the principal Regulations”). The principal Regulations implement Council Directive 69/208/EEC (replaced by 2002/57/EC) on the marketing of seed of oil and fibre plants.

Mae'r Rheoliadau hyn yn diwygio Rheoliadau Hadau Planhigion Olew a Ffibr 1993 (O.S. 1993/2007) fel y'u diwygiwyd (“y prif Reoliadau”). Mae'r prif Reoliadau yn gweithredu Cyfarwyddeb y Cyngor 69/208/EEC (a ddisodlwyd gan 2002/57/EC) ar farchnata hadau planhigion olew a ffibr.

title.div: The Nurses Agencies (Wales) Regulations 2003 / Rheoliadau Asiantaethau Nyrsys (Cymru) 2003

ukm:Subject.Value: NURSES, MIDWIVES AND HEALTH VISITORS, WALES

category.term: NURSES, MIDWIVES AND HEALTH VISITORS, WALES
NYRSYS, BYDWRAGEDD AC YMWELWYR IECHYD, CYMRU

div.p: These Regulations are made under the Care Standards Act 2000 (“the Act”), and apply in relation to nurses agencies in Wales only. Parts I and II of the Act provide for the National Assembly for Wales, in relation to Wales, to register and inspect establishments and agencies, including nurses agencies. The Act also provides for the Assembly to make regulations governing the conduct of establishments and agencies.

Mae'r Rheoliadau hyn yn cael eu gwneud o dan Ddeddf Safonau Gofal 2000 (“y Ddeddf”), ac maent yn gymwys i asiantaethau nyrsys yng Nghymru yn unig. Mae Rhannau I a II o'r Ddeddf yn darparu mai Cynulliad Cenedlaethol Cymru, mewn perthynas â Chymru a fydd yn cofrestru ac yn archwilio sefydliadau ac asiantaethau, gan gynnwys asiantaethau nyrsys. Mae'r Ddeddf hefyd yn darparu mai'r Cynulliad fydd yn gwneud rheoliadau sy'n llywodraethu'r ffordd y mae sefydliadau ac asiantaethau yn cael eu rhedeg.

entry.title: The Housing Benefit and Council Tax Benefit (State Pension Credit and Miscellaneous Amendments) (Amendment) Regulations 2003
entry.summary: These Regulations amend regulation 5(3) of the Housing Benefit and Council Tax Benefit (State Pension Credit and Miscellaneous Amendments) Regulations 2003, which inserted paragraph (7C).

entry.title: The Collagen and Gelatine (Intra Community Trade) (Scotland) Revocation Regulations 2003
entry.summary: These Regulations, which extend to Scotland only, revoke the Collagen and Gelatine (Intra-Community Trade) (Scotland) regulations 2003 (“the principal Regulations”) as amended.

entry.title: The Health and Personal Social Services (Assessment of Resources) (Amendment No. 2) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2003
entry.summary: These Regulations make further amendments to the Health and Personal Social Services (Assessment of Resources) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1993 (“the principal regulations”) which relate to the assessment by Health and Social Services Boards and HSS trusts of the resources of residents in accommodation arranged under Articles 15 and 36 of the Health and Personal Social Services (Northern Ireland) Order 1972.

entry.title: The Feeding Stuffs (Scotland) Amendment (No. 3) Regulations 2003
entry.summary: These Regulations, which extend to Scotland only, further amend the Feeding Stuffs (Scotland) Regulations 2000 (S.S.I. 2000/453, as already amended).

entry.title: Police Trainee (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2003
entry.summary: These regulations amend the Police Trainee Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2001 by allowing the Chief Constable to impose different requirements as to the period of service and training for police trainees with previous policing experience.

entry.title: The Cromarty Firth Port Authority (Constitution) Revision Order 2003
entry.summary: This Order reconstitutes the Cromarty Firth Port Authority. It provides for the appointment of members of the Authority with experience in relevant matters, makes other provision with respect to the Authority and amends the borrowing powers of the Authority.

entry.title: Employer’s Liability (Compulsory Insurance) Exemption (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2003
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Employer’s Liability (Compulsory Insurance) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1999 (“the principal Regulations”). The principal Regulations specify employers who are exempted from the requirements of Part III of the Employer’s Liability (Defective Equipment and Compulsory Insurance) (Northern Ireland) Order 1972 (“the 1972 Order”) to insure and maintain insurance against liability for personal injury suffered by their employees and arising out of and in the course of their employment. The specified employers are certain public bodies; the specified classes of employer include any employer to the extent that he is required to insure under a compulsory motor insurance scheme by virtue of the fact that his employees are carried on, or are alighting from or are entering into, a motor vehicle. The exemptions specified in the principal Regulations are additional to those contained in Article 7 of the 1972 Order.

entry.title: The City of Coventry (Electoral Changes) Order 2003
entry.summary: This Order gives effect, with four modifications, to recommendations by the Boundary Committee for England, a committee of the Electoral Commission, for electoral changes in the city of Coventry.

entry.title: The Civic Government (Scotland) Act 1982 (Licensing of Houses in Multiple Occupation) Amendment Order 2003
entry.summary: This Order makes amendments to the Civic Government (Scotland) Act 1982 (Licensing of Houses in Multiple Occupation) Order 2000 (“the 2000 Order”). The 2000 Order was first amended by S.S.I. 2002/161.

entry.title: The Borough of Walsall (Electoral Changes) Order 2003
entry.summary: This Order gives effect, with two modifications, to recommendations by the Boundary Committee for England, a committee of the Electoral Commission, for electoral changes in the borough of Walsall.
